intro: Lysimachia secunda, commonly known as lesser yellow loosestrife, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the summer months. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. Lysimachia secunda is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and filter water.
